movies.title: Ninja vs. Shaolin Guard
movies.plot: A troop of monks from the Shaolin Temple embark on a mission to get the Golden Sutra to Tibet after the Shaolin Abbot is killed by their traitorous teacher. They are joined on their quest by a beautiful, female warrior - with aims to avenge her father's death. They traverse forests and mountains on their mission, all the while fighting off deadly ninja assassins, vicious gangsters and even the undead.
movies.simplePlot: A troop of monks from the Shaolin Temple embark on a mission to get the Golden Sutra to Tibet after the Shaolin Abbot is killed by their traitorous teacher. They are joined on their quest ...

biography.name: Fei Chan

biography.bio: Yuen-cheh Chin is an actor, known for Ninja vs. Shaolin Guard (1984).
biography.name: Yuen-cheh Chin

biography.bio: Eagle Han is known for his work on Shaolin contre Mantis (1982), The Snake Strikes Back (1981) and Revenge of the Drunken Master (1984).
biography.name: Eagle Han

biography.bio: Eun-suk Lee is an actress, known for Chil soyeo bokseong (1988), She Cried Like the Rain (1984) and Yongho sanggwon (1985).
biography.name: Eun-suk Lee

biography.bio: Hai Hsing Li is known for his work on Aloha, the Little Vampire (1987), Kong-Fu Wonder Child (1986) and Ninja Kids (1982).
biography.name: Hai Hsing Li

biography.bio: Alexander Lo won the Taiwan 1978 Tae Kwan do championship, and got into the movie business after his older brother Tong Lung introduced him to director Robert Tai, with whom he most frequently collaborated. Alexander worked on many films about Ninjas, such as Wu Tang vs. Ninja (1987), The Super Ninja (1986), Shaolin vs. Ninja (1983), Ninja Condors (1987), and Mafia vs. Ninja (1985). He also worked on Shaolin films such as Shaolin Chastity Kung Fu (1981) and the famous Shaolin vs. Lama (1983). In 1984, Tai directed Lou in a nine-hour epic titled Ninja: The Final Duel (1986), and some time after this epic film, Alexander quit acting but did not stop making movies. He continued a long partnership with Robert Tai, only this time as an action choreographer, working on such films as Fist of Legends 2: Iron Bodyguards (1996). He often collaborated with his good friend, the African-American kick-boxer Eugene Thomas (Trammell), where they either fought together as a black/Asian duo, or faced up against each other as arch enemies.
biography.name: Alexander Rei Lo

biography.bio: Robert Tai is known for his work on Shaolin Dolemite (1999), Fist of Legends 2: Iron Bodyguards (1996) and Death List (2006).
biography.name: Robert Tai

biography.bio: Ryong Wang is known for his work on Yongho sanggwon (1985), A Strange Story (1983) and Affair of the Gold Bars (1966).
biography.name: Ryong Wang

biography.bio: Yung Yeh is known for his work on Legend of the Drunken Tiger (1990), Shaolin Chastity Kung Fu (1981) and Shaolin vs. Ninja (1983).
biography.name: Yung Yeh
